The resolution also calls on states tp "end all forms of direct and indirect interaction and business with the illegal Israeli colonial and apartheid regime."

headline: Ben & Jerry's sues its parent company, Unilever, for silencing its support for Palestinian rights
summary: Ice cream brand Ben & Jerry's files a lawsuit against its parent company Unilever, accusing the company of silencing its attempts to express support for Palestinian human rights. In 2021, Ben & Jerry's announced it would not renew its licensing agreement with its Israeli licensee in order to end sales of its ice cream in illegal Israeli settlements in the Occupied Palestinian Territory.

headline: City of Belfast, Maine approves divestment proposal
summary: The City Council of Belfast, Maine votes 5-0 to approve a proposal to divest from two companies complicit in the Israeli genocide in Gaza and to prohibit future investments in such companies. City officials did not name the companies.

headline: Democracy in Europe Movement 2025, DiEM 25 endorses BDS
summary: Democracy in Europe Movement 2025, a pan-European political alliance, endorses the BDS movement, saying in a statement, "For too long, the international community has stood by as the Israeli government enacts systemic violence, settler-colonialism, and apartheid against Palestinians."

headline: Watchkeeper Mk1 with Elbit Systems into early retirement
Strauss Group sells holdings in Sabra Hummus
summary: Strauss Group, a multinational Israeli food and beverage company, sells its 50% holdings in Sabra and Obela. Sabra Hummus has been the the target of a boycott campaign due to Strauss Group's financial support to the Israeli military.

headline: Australia ends partnership with the Israeli ministry of defense
Lewisham Council Pensions Investment Committee adopts divestment amendment
summary: Lewisham Council Pensions Investment Committee in the UK passes a motion to divest from companies involved in "controversial weapons, human rights abuses and any company with significant operations within an area considered occupied territory under international law."

headline: Canadian Association of University Teachers affirms right to boycott
summary: The Canadian Association of University Teachers, representing 72,000 faculty members and academic staff in Canada, adopts a resolution that "fully stands behind the 18 Faculty associations that have passed motions calling for boycott and/or divestment and/or sanctions of the State of Israel." The resolution also reaffirms CAUT's 2021 resolution opposing the adoption of the IHRA definition of antisemitism, noting that it has been weaponized to "censor and impede the academic freedom of teachers and researchers who have developed anti-racist and decolonial perspectives on the policies and practices of the state of Israel" and "conflates criticism of the policies of the state of Israel with antisemitism."

headline: National Union of Metalworkers of South Africa (NUMSA) calls for sanctions against Israel
summary: National Union of Metalworkers of South Africa (NUMSA), the largest trade union in South Africa representing 338,000 members, calls on the South African government to sever diplomatic ties with Israel and imposing sanctions on it.

headline: Colombia plans not to replace Israeli Kfir jets with Israeli jets.
Chile ends multi-million dollar satellite deal with Israeli company
summary: The Chilean Air Force announces the cancellation of a multi-million dollar satellite deal with Israel’s ImageSat International "due to the failure of the supplier company to meet contractual objectives." ImageSat complains after the company failed to meet its contractual obligations. The Israeli company complained that "the political climate in Chile is difficult for Israeli companies."

headline: 18 Canadian faculty associations adopt BDS measures
summary: Eighteen Canadian faculty and academic associations, representing thousands of academic faculty and staff, adopt BDS measures in 2024 alone. Measures included calling on universities to divest from companies complicit in Israeli apartheid and genocide and pledging to participate in the academic boycott of complicit Israeli institutions.

headline: Hundreds of Belgian and French artists sign pledge to boycott Israeli cultural institutions
summary: Hundreds of Belgian and French artists sign a pledge to boycott Israeli cultural institutions that are implicated in its genocide against Palestinians in Gaza and underlying regime of settler-colonialism and apartheid.

headline: Chile's airforce cancels a satellite program because the Israeli company ImageSat International fails to meet its obligations as relations sour.
CAUT:
Norway's sovereign wealth fund divests from Bezeq
summary: Norway's sovereign wealth fund, the world's largest, sells all of its shares in Bezeq, Israel’s largest telecoms company, due to its “services to the Israeli settlements in the occupied West Bank.” The Fund's Council on Ethics said the company "is helping to facilitate the maintenance and expansion of [Israeli] settlements, which are illegal under international law."

headline: UK forced to review F35 exports to Israel
Nelson City Council in Aotearoa (New Zealand) votes to boycott settlement businesses
summary: The members of Nelson City Council in in Aotearoa (New Zealand) vote to update their procurement policies to exclude businesses that operate in illegal Israeli settlements in the occupied Palestinian territory.

headline: Tilburg University Advisory Committee recommends suspending ties with Israeli universities
summary: The Advisory Committee of Tilburg University in the Netherlands recommends suspending ties with Israeli universities over their complicity in Israel’s “gross and systematic violations of human rights and fundamental freedoms” of Palestinians.

headline: Tilburg University:
Yale students overwhelmingly pass divestment referendum
summary: Yale students vote 76% in favor of a referendum calling on the universit to divest the university's $41 billion endowment from military weapons manufacturers, “including those arming Israel,” with 56 student organizations endorsing the referendum.

headline: Netherlands Trade Union Confederation goes on strike for academic boycott
summary: The Netherlands Trade Union Confederation (FNV), the union representing many University of Amsterdam (UvA) staff, undertakes a 4-day strike after the university's Executive Board failed to respond to their demands to suspend ties with complicit Israeli institutions. The strike, supported by 84% of staff union members, marks the first formal union strike for the academic boycott of Israel.

headline: Alameda County divests $35m in public funds from Caterpillar
summary: Alameda County becomes the first county in the country to divest its tax revenues from Caterpillar bonds. The country treasurer says most of the investments had already been sold off and the final investments would be sold soon.

headline: Alameda County, California divests $32 million from Caterpillar
summary: Alameda County, California divests $32 million in public funds from Caterpillar over its role in supplying the Israeli military and votes to adopt an ethical investment policy.

headline: Australia denies visas to suspected Israeli war criminals
Portsmouth University and College Union pass divestment motion
summary: Portsmouth University and College Union votes overwhelmingly for a motion calling for Portsmouth University to “sever all ties – financial and otherwise – with all external bodies, businesses and organisations complicit in Israel’s genocide in Gaza and rapidly escalating regional war.”

headline: Israel launches a plan to spend tens of billions of NIS to produce weapons domestically in order to overcome the military embargo
Eight former Modern Language Association (MLA) presidents call for vote on BDS motion
summary: Eight former Modern Language Association (MLA) presidents, including Judith Butler, urge MLA, one of the largest US scholarly organizations in the humanities, to allow members to debate and vote on a BDS motion. Their statement comes after the MLA Executive Council refused to allow the organization’s Delegate Assembly to vote on a resolution stating that members support the BDS movement, on the grounds that this would potentially lead to a drop-off in revenue in states with anti-BDS laws.

headline: Daystar University in Kenya rescinds an agreement with the Israeli Embassy
summary: Daystar University in Kenya rescinds an agreement signed with the Israeli Embassy to establish a "Zion Forest" green space on campus following public outcry.

headline: 20 Congresspeople urge administration to halt arms shipments to Israel
Swedish dockworkers’ union votes not to handle weapons shipments to Israel
summary: The Swedish dockworkers’ union Svenska hamnarbetarförbundet votes in favour of a “blockade against handling war material to and from Israel’s apartheid and genocidal regime.” This decision impacts Swedish’s import of weapons from Israeli companies such as Israel’s largest arms manufacturer, Elbit Systems.

headline: Swedish dockworkers movement joins BDS and vows to refuse arms shipments to Israel
MIT Graduate Student Council votes in favor of BDS resolution
summary: MIT Graduate Student Council votes in favor of a resolution calling on MIT “to take immediate steps to end all research funding sponsorships by the Israeli military.”

headline: 150 Scottish arts organisations endorse cultural boycott
summary: More than 150 Scottish arts organisations, collectives, community groups, magazines, festivals, venues, and other cultural initiatives endorse a cultural boycott of Israel.

headline: Dockworkers vote to block military shipments to and from Israel
Activists block the port of Bilbao to demand an end of collaboration with genocide
Five students at the University of Leicester go on hunger strike to protest complicity with genocide and demand that Barclays end funancial ties to companies that sell weapons to Israel.
Oosto, formerly AnyVision, sold for only $125 million to US parking lot company Metropolis,  because of occupation controversy.
Coalition of Women in Germany joins academic boycott
summary: The Coalition of Women in Germany, a feminist scholarly organization, announces support for academic boycott of complicit Israeli institutions.

headline: UK High Court rules to proceed on case against F35 parts to Israel.
Lula cancels the ATMOS artillery tender with Elbit Systems
Belgium regional court passes bill to impose sanctions on Israel including a military embargo.
230 global civil society organizations call to stop arming Israel with F35 jets and parts
Danish lawyers file case against arms exports to Israel (Amnesty International)
Copenhagen protest camp against Maersk
Ministry of Defense tender for new assault rifles demands that at least 54% of the production and materials must be local to Israel to defend against military embargoes
Legal opinino by Ascomare confirms that flag states have a responsibility to stop weapon shipments to Israel.
Protest against Maersk cargo ship carrying F35 parts to Israel
Weapons for IMI worth 250,000 Euro confiscated in Ravena.
Complaint to the Connecticut attorney general: Yale's investments in companies selling arms to Isrfael violates state law
Protestors, unions and lawyers stopped the shipping of arms through Antwerpen by the ZIM company
Dutch government revokes general export license for military equipment and dual-use goods to Israel
Lawsuit failed, Farah v. Canada (Foreign Affairs) to end sales of F35 parts to Israel
Rafael arms company reports that its costs increase because of the military embarg
Citizens Initiative gets more than 50,000 signatures, forcing the Finnish parliament to discuss arms imports from Israel
Spain scraps bullet deal with Israel following outcry
Kildare company to stop exporting parts used in Israeli fighter jets
Deelgation for relations with Palestine holds a discussion on military embargo
Maersk halts use of the Fos-sur-mer port after dockworkers delay ships carrying F35 parts to Israel
Barcelonar court investigates two Maersk ships for suspicion of delivering weapons to Israel.
Military embargo bill endorsed for a vote
Protest at the DSEI arms fair against the Skystriker drone
Rights groups take UK government to court over arms sales to Israel
Italian jurists warn Meloni gov't to terminate Israel defense pact
Chile withdraws military attaches from Israel embassy
Antigua and Barbuda orders the ship HC Opal sailing under its flag not to deliver weapons to Israel
Spain cancels Spike deal with Rafael
Israeli arms company IWI admits it withdrew from a government tender to make rifles because a machine it ordered never arrived as a result of the military embargo.
NB Federation of Labour voted to call on unions to refuse to handle weapon shipments bound to Israel.
Dockworkers in France refuse to load container of ammunition parts bound for Israel
summary: The CGT trade union of the Fos-sur-Mer dockers announced that the container had been set aside and that they will not "load it on the boat bound for Haifa". They refused to "participate in the ongoing genocide orchestrated by the Israeli government."

headline: Popular mobilization against a ZIM ship in Genoa.
Lawsuit to stop a shipment of weapons through Antwerpen
World Council of Churches denounces Israel’s apartheid and occupation, calls for divestment and sanctions
summary: The organization, which brings together churches representing over 580 million Christians in more than 120 countries, called on states and churches “to impose consequences for violations of international law, including targeted sanctions, divestment, and arms embargoes.”
